context: The Finnish verb 'puhua' means 'to speak'. It is an intransitive verb, but can sometimes be transitive. The word originates from Proto-Finnic *puhudak meaning 'to blow', and it shares roots with Northern Sami 'bossut'.  It conjugates regularly according to the Kotus type 52/sanoa pattern. You can use it to express speaking a language ('Minä puhun suomea' - I speak Finnish), having a conversation ('Puhumme tästä myöhemmin' - We will talk about this later) or delivering a speech ('Hän puhui puhelimessa tunnin' - He spoke on the phone for an hour).
